title: Dinesh Nirmal - IBM Newsroom
summary: Dinesh Nirmal has been promoted to Senior Vice President, Products, IBM Software, and is responsibile for new products and innovation, the company’s software product and technology direction, location strategy, support, and ecosystem development, including the company’s Data, AI, Automation software portfolio and Cloud Pak strategy. In this role, Dinesh also leads product development for IBM Cloud Integration, where he rebuilt the business to focus on automation, and IBM Data and AI, where he has led the transformation to factor AI into every part of IBM's software and hardware portfolio.

summary: The global enterprise software market is expected to reach $404 billion by 2028. The market is driven by the increasing use of automation, big data analytics, and artificial intelligence. summary: 1) In this digital economy, companies need to use HR technology to increase their market value and stay competitive. 2) Effective HR tech leadership positively correlates to company market value because it gives companies a competitive advantage through low operational costs and high complexity.  3) An integrated IT system reduces costs by optimizing supply chains and customer communications.

title: Vapes – a burning issue - Circular Online
summary: E-cigarettes are contributing to a mountain of hard-to-recycle waste in the UK, especially disposable vapes. The problem is compounded by the fact that up to 60% of disposable vapes sold in the UK are illicit, and many are littered. The existing waste regulations could be tweaked to take account of these relatively new products.

title: Top 10 Use Cases of Digital Twin in the Year 2023 - Analytics Insight
summary: Digital Twin is making significant progress, and firms are embracing it to revolutionize their operations and product development. The technology's capabilities are continuously evolving, and its ability to link various processes and tools through common formats like USD and glTF is increasing its adaptability. As a result, numerous industries are exploring use cases of Digital Twin to enhance their operations.

title: EGA unveils aluminium recycling initiative amid sustainability push - The National
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) has launched an Aluminium Recycling Coalition with beverage producers, can makers, and waste management companies to increase recycling rates in the UAE. The UAE aims to achieve net zero by 2050 and has pledged Dh600 billion ($163.5 billion) in investments in clean and renewable energy sources over the next three decades. EGA, one of the world's largest aluminium producers, is developing its own technology to decarbonize operations and reduce emissions.
green_innovation: TRUE; The Aluminium Recycling Coalition aims to increase recycling rates of aluminium, particularly beverage cans, in the UAE. Aluminium is an infinitely recyclable material that plays a key role in achieving net zero.
business_innovation: TRUE; The Aluminium Recycling Coalition is a new initiative that brings together companies from across the aluminium value chain to improve recycling rates. The coalition is developing new technologies and processes to make aluminium recycling more efficient and cost-effective.
green_product: TRUE; Aluminium is a green product because it is infinitely recyclable. Aluminium cans have a high recycling rate compared to other beverage containers, and they can be recycled into new products without losing any of their quality.
green_process: TRUE; The Aluminium Recycling Coalition is developing new processes to make aluminium recycling more efficient and cost-effective. These processes will help to reduce the environmental impact of aluminium production and consumption.
